verbs.description: cutify (third-person singular simple present cutifies, present participle cutifying, simple past and past participle cutified)

description: From cute +‎ -ify, perhaps with influence from beautify.

verbs.description: cutify (third-person singular simple present cutifies, present participle cutifying, simple past and past participle cutified)

examples: “Vaudeville wouldn’t even eat in the same restaurants or stay in the same hotels as burlesque,” she was saying now. “There really were classes of people. And vaudeville was very proud, extremely proud. In Gypsy, burlesque was all cutified, not the way it really was, down and dirty, men with raw liver and milk bottles masturbating. […]”
